title: How to Make a Lotion Bar with Almond Oil

steps.headline: Visit the craft or health food store to compile ingredients.
steps.description: You’ll need a 1 lb. bar of beeswax, ½ cup of almond oil and ½ cup of coconut oil.

steps.headline: Locate your double boiler or create your own using two pans and a little water.
steps.description: This will be the tool you use to melt the bars down to create your own slice of skin paradise.

steps.headline: Find a cupcake or muffin pan.
steps.description: You could also use an ice cube tray to make smaller lotion bars but find a mold at home that works best for you. Also, silicone pans (with fun shapes like stars or flowers) are also fun and could be used if you are making lotion bars to live as gifts.

steps.headline: Set up your double boiler or create your own at home.
steps.description: If you don’t own a double boiler, make one using a pan filled halfway with water, topped with a non-combustible bowl. For best results use a tin bowl instead of glass (to avoid the possibility it could shatter during the cooking process). Turn the heat to low or medium low to allow the water to simmer.

steps.headline: Combine ingredients in double boiler or bowl.
steps.description: Mix 1/5 of the lb. bar of beeswax and allow that to melt first.

steps.headline: Add ½ cup of almond oil and ½ cup of coconut oil as the beeswax is beginning to liquefy.
steps.description: As you add the oils, stir slowly to integrate the oils into the beeswax.

steps.headline: Pour mixture directly into your mold receptacle (cupcake pan, ice cube tray, etc.).
steps.description: Be sure you don’t allow any water to drip into the mold from the bottom of the bowl or double boiler as water could compromise the quality of the lotion bar.

steps.headline: Place mold pan in a cool area of the home and allow to sit overnight.
steps.description: No need to refrigerate although you could if you prefer (to speed the setting process).

steps.headline: Tap the side of the pan once lotion has set and/or twist to remove bars.
steps.description: If necessary you could warm up the bottom of the pan (slightly) to make the removal process easy, however bars should slide out since they are made from wax and oil.

text: Gather Supplies and Ingredients Visit the craft or health food store to compile ingredients. You’ll need a 1 lb. bar of beeswax, ½ cup of almond oil and ½ cup of coconut oil. Locate your double boiler or create your own using two pans and a little water. This will be the tool you use to melt the bars down to create your own slice of skin paradise. Find a cupcake or muffin pan. You could also use an ice cube tray to make smaller lotion bars but find a mold at home that works best for you. Also, silicone pans (with fun shapes like stars or flowers) are also fun and could be used if you are making lotion bars to live as gifts. Make Almond Oil Lotion Bars Set up your double boiler or create your own at home. If you don’t own a double boiler, make one using a pan filled halfway with water, topped with a non-combustible bowl. For best results use a tin bowl instead of glass (to avoid the possibility it could shatter during the cooking process). Turn the heat to low or medium low to allow the water to simmer. Combine ingredients in double boiler or bowl. Mix 1/5 of the lb. bar of beeswax and allow that to melt first. Add ½ cup of almond oil and ½ cup of coconut oil as the beeswax is beginning to liquefy. As you add the oils, stir slowly to integrate the oils into the beeswax. Pour mixture directly into your mold receptacle (cupcake pan, ice cube tray, etc.). Be sure you don’t allow any water to drip into the mold from the bottom of the bowl or double boiler as water could compromise the quality of the lotion bar. Place mold pan in a cool area of the home and allow to sit overnight. No need to refrigerate although you could if you prefer (to speed the setting process). Tap the side of the pan once lotion has set and/or twist to remove bars. If necessary you could warm up the bottom of the pan (slightly) to make the removal process easy, however bars should slide out since they are made from wax and oil.
